articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's government on Wednesday proposed banning younger generations from ever buying cigarettes, a move that would give the country some of the world's toughest smoking rules and hurt the sales of major tobacco firms.
articles.title: Britain proposes ban on cigarettes for younger generations

articles.author: Joseph White
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) on Wednesday secured a new $6 billion line of credit and estimated that the cost of the United Auto Workers strike was $200 million during the third quarter, a company spokesman said.
articles.title: GM locks in $6 billion credit line as strike costs rise

articles.author: Lananh Nguyen, Tatiana Bautzer, Saeed Azhar
articles.description: Citigroup (C.N) managers are reviewing staff rosters to determine by November who will stay in place, be reassigned or laid off during its biggest reorganization in decades, according to a global memo to staff on Wednesday seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Citigroup outlines layoff process, reassignments in overhaul -memo

articles.author: Herbert Lash, Tom Wilson
articles.description: A rout in government bond markets deepened early on Wednesday with benchmark U.S. yields hitting fresh 16-year highs as investors bet that persistently high interest rates will slow world growth and dampen the appetite for riskier assets.
articles.title: Global bond rout deepens before receding on relief rally

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Apple (AAPL.O) Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook made $41.5 million after taxes in his biggest share sale in two years, a U.S. securities filing showed.
articles.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook makes $41 mln from biggest stock sale in two years

articles.author: Yuvraj Malik, Max Cherney
articles.description: Alphabet's Google (GOOGL.O) on Wednesday launched Pixel 8 smartphones and a new smartwatch that integrate its artificial intelligence (AI) technology more deeply into the company's consumer gadgets.
articles.title: Google launches Pixel 8, smartwatch with new AI feature

articles.author: Ahmed Aboulenein, Steve Gorman
articles.description: Kaiser Permanente and union negotiators for 75,000 striking medical workers suspended a marathon round of contract talks without a settlement on Wednesday, the two sides said, hours after the largest such walkout ever in the U.S. healthcare sector commenced.
articles.title: Kaiser Permanente and unions for 75,000 striking health workers hit bargaining snag

articles.author: Richard Cowan, David Morgan, Moira Warburton
articles.description: The U.S. House of Representatives was leaderless on Wednesday, after hardline Republicans narrowly won a vote to oust Speaker Kevin McCarthy, an historic move that triggered what will be a lengthy and likely messy battle to find a replacement.
articles.title: US House adrift as Republicans fight over their next leader

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Two families, one enslaved by the other. In many ways, their journeys since emancipation illustrate a broader truth about U.S. history: the legacy of slavery.
articles.title: American Dreams

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan issued an advisory for a tsunami of 1 metre for the islands off of Izu peninsula on the eastern coast of the country.
articles.title: Japan issues tsunami advisory for islands in eastern Japan
